HHanin NajjarMultimedia Journalist + Product Manager + Gen Z Expert

About

Ahlan! Welcome to my website. My name is Hanin (pronounced Ha-NEEN).

Like many journalists, I am someone who never stops learning. Coming from a family of academics, I had to get a master's degree so I got a MS in Journalism with a focus on Media Innovation and Content Strategy at Northwestern University. As an autodidact, I also taught myself programs like Adobe Premiere and Asana and skills like SEO and digital marketing.

Unlike many journalists though, I’m good with numbers and data and I’m not afraid to get my hands dirty. So if you ask me what the square root of 23865*7651993/88615 is, I mostly won’t run away. Mostly. But through data-driven insights, my skillset places me in the space where media intersects with business, tech and innovation. That’s where disruption happens and that’s where I’ll be.

Over the course of my academia and work experience, I have worked in nonprofit and for-profit spaces and developed, launched and managed multiple media products including digital publications, email newsletters and online courses. My proudest product is SheMade Digital - a mission-driven publication empowering Gen Z women of color personally, professionally and financially.

You can check out some of my multimedia storytelling work on the Multimedia page, or my work with media products, research and AI on the Innovation page. Feel free to download my resume or contact me with any questions.

read more

SheMade

SheMade Digital is a digital publication and media organization empowering Gen Z women of color personally, professionally and financially. I founded SheMade Digital in 2022, building a webiste, a team and a product strategy. Recently, SheMade launched She Builds Wealth, an introductory financial literacy course for women of color in their 20s.

Short Documentaries

Superabundant is Oregon Public Broadcasting's a digital-first documentary series about food and ingredients in the Pacific Northwest. While interning on the organization's digital team, I worked with the documentary team to create the episode on robots and honey.

Pacific University hosts a Luau every year, their biggest annual event, to celebrate the large population of students from Hawai'i. However, the event has drawn criticism from Native Hawaiian students and their allies.

News Packages

Vandalism is on the rise in Eugene, Oregon and business owners are frustrated with the lack of response and action from the local police department.

The Eugene Police Department rolled out a new piece of security technology in hopes of increasing safetly but many community members see it as an invasion of privacy.

Feature & Fundraiser

The Virginia Garcia Memorial Health Center hosts parenting lessons for families in the Spanish-speaking community in the Portland Metro area as well as other community services including classes and medical assistance. I created this video with the help of 3 other students for our Video for Community Engagement class.

While Americans recieve their COVID stimulous checks from the government, undocumented immigrants recieve no support and no job security. Centro Cultural is raising money to help support these vulnerable families in need.

Photos

COVID Nurses

Nurses in the COVID ward at the Oregon Health and Science University Hospital share their experiences and struggles with the new wave of the virus, August 18, 2021.

March for Palestine

Across the country and around the world people marched and protested for a ceasefire and an end to the occupation in Palestine in late 2023 and early 2024. These photographs were taken in protests in downtown Chicago.

Many families brought their children to these peaceful demonstrations, allowing them to participate and bring awareness to the children being killed. The photo on left and right of the first row below were taken in Portland, Oregon while the rest of the photos were taken in Chicago.

Eid Mubarak

Muslims in the greater Portland area come together at last to celebrate Eid Al-Adha as COVID-19 restrictions begin to lift, July 20, 2021.

Events

From choosing a venue and curating to coaching speakers and launching marketing campaigns, I have quite a bit of experience in planning events. TEDxPacificU was one of those events. In 2019, I worked alongside 14 other talented team members to plan, organize and execute a TEDx conference. For about a year, I wore multiple hats. As speech coach, I helped 8 speakers outline, draft and present their speeches. As event marketing coordinator, I developed our social media strategies as well as the distribution of our physical advertismeents such as flyers and posters. On March 16, 2019, we had a successful event with 8 speakers, 3 performers and an audience of about 300.

IInnovationProduct Management + Artificial Intelligence + Content Strategy

Masters

After working for a few years, I decided to go back to school and get a Master of Science in Journalism at Northwestern University’s Medill School of Journalism. The program I chose includes a specialization in Media Innovation and Content Strategy. This study sits at the intersection of media, business and technology and focuses on product and strategy.

Throughout my studies, I took many classes where I worked in groups, often across cross-functional disciplines, to develop media and AI products from ideation to prototype to launch. Read about some of my experiences and products below.

Custom.ai.ze

Northwestern University’s Farley Center for Entrepreneurship and Innovation offers a course called NUvention Media. This project-based course builds interdisciplinary teams of computer science, business and journalism students to build AI-driven media products and envision the future of media.

I worked as a product manager on a cross functional team that developed an AI product , called Custom.ai.ze, that generates hyper-personalized product descriptions. Custom.ai.ze is designed as a B2B product for online retailers that are looking to personalize the descriptions of their products to their individua users to capture and retain audiencesand convert them to sales. Although my team focused on online retailers, this product could also be used to hyperpersonalize the product description of services, and experiences.

Product

Focused on both digital and tech products, my master’s program trained me to become a product manager using agile methodology. In my Digital & Tech Product Management course, I led a team develop a product and prototype for an online financial literacy platform for women in their 20s.

After conducting market research, we found that the online courses industry is rapidly growing and expected to pass $300 billion by 2025. Additionally, women are entering the work force at record numbers but still falling behind in financial literacy. We conducted user interviews of our target segment and created a product roadmap, backlog and user stories using agile. We then wrote market requirement and product requirement documents and pitched the project for launch.

Knight

The Knight Lab at Northwestern University is a community of designers, developers and journalists working to create new research and tools to help journalists and push journalism into new spaces. In this class, I researched the future of social media, particularly decentralized niche platforms and their experimentation with monetization outside of an advertising model.

Additionally, I researched the problems that journalists and journalism organizations face on current existing social media platforms. For example, many platforms such as Twitter and Instagram are not prioritizing or deprioritizing external links in order to keep users on their platforms. Journalists are getting more harassment than news tips and its becoming harder to share news stories in online communities. Addressing these problems I researched solutions including social news apps like Artifact and pitches new solutions for monetization and community.

In this class, I was also exposed to AI experimentation with short-form video where the user could create an animated persona and feed it scripts which could potentially be used in newsrooms with limited resources.
